sentences: Eks vanematega kohtumine oli r천천msam kui olin eeldanud.
Ta ei saa ilma vanematega l채bi.
context: The word 'vanematega' is an Estonian adessive case form of the plural noun 'vanemad' (parents/elders) combined with the adessive ending '-ga'. It means 'with parents' or 'with elders', indicating accompaniment or association. The adessive case in Estonian typically answers the question 'kuidas?' (how?) or 'kellega?' (with whom?).
